prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a tapering top Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. Step 3: Create faces, loops, and curves Create a face (face\\_1) and within it, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of the following line segments: * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.375, 0.5] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.375, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] * line\\_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.5 units in the positive direction (towards the normal). Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.25, 0.0, 0.125] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. Step 3: Create faces, loops, and curves Create a face (face\\_1) and within it, create a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of the following circle: * circle\\_1: Center [0.125, 0.125], Radius: 0.125 Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.25. Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch perpendicular to the X-Y plane by 0.5 units in the negative direction (opposite the normal). Final Shape The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Part 1 Details * Shape: A three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a tapering top. * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.5 * Height: 0.75 Part 2 Details * Shape: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. * Length: 0.25 * Width: 0.5 * Height: 0.25 Final Shape Details * Shape: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.5 * Height (excluding cylindrical hole): 0.75 * Cylindrical hole length: 0.25 * Cylindrical hole diameter: 0.25</description>

prompt: <description>3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) 2. Create the first sketch on face 1: * Sketch a series of connected lines forming a polygon with the following vertices (in meters): 1. (0, 0.5) 2. (0.5, 0) 3. (0.75, 0.125) 4. (0.375, 0.5) 5. (0, 0.5) * The sketch represents the top face of the prism. 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.5 meters along the normal direction. Set the operation to create a new solid body. Part 2: Construct the triangular cutout on the side of the prism: 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.5, 0.0, 0.25) 2. Create the first sketch on face 1: * Sketch a rectangle with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.25 m * Width: 0.5 m 3. Extrude the sketch by 0.25 m along the negative normal direction. Set the operation to join with a previous body. Part 3: Construct the bottom part of the prism: 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) 2. Create the first sketch on face 1: * Sketch a rectangle with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.5 m * Width: 0.5 m 3. Extrude the sketch by 0.5 m along the positive normal direction. Set the operation to join with a previous body. The final shape has the following dimensions: * Length (part 1): 0.75 m * Width (part 1): 0.75 m * Height (part 1): 0.5 m * Length (part 2): 0.25 m * Width (part 2): 0.5 m * Height (part 2): 0.25 m * Length (part 3): 0.5 m * Width (part 3): 0.5 m * Height (part 3): 0.5 m</description>

The operation for this part is to create a new solid body.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system. Use the following euler angles and translation vector: Euler Angles: - x: -90.0° - y: 0.0° - z: -90.0° Translation Vector: - x: 0.0 - y: 0.0 - z: 0.0 Step 2: Draw 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a closed loop with the following curve segments: - Line 1: Start Point: (0.0, 0.0) End Point: (0.5, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point: (0.5, 0.0) End Point: (0.5, 0.25) - Arc 1: Start Point: (0.5, 0.25) Mid Point: (0.25, 0.5) End Point: (0.0, 0.25) - Line 3: Start Point: (0.0, 0.25) End Point: (0.0, 0.0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.5. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Use the euler angles and translation vector defined for the coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to create a 3D solid model. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.25 towards the normal and do not extrude in the opposite direction. The sketch scale should be 0.5. Join this part to the previous parts. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system. Use the following euler angles and translation vector: Euler Angles: - x: 0.0° - y: 0.0° - z: -90.0° Translation Vector: - x: 0.0 - y: 0.5 - z: 0.0 Step 2: Draw 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a closed loop with the following curve segments: - Line 1: Start Point: (0.0, 0.0) End Point: (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point: (0.75, 0.0) End Point: (0.75, 0.125) - Line 3: Start Point: (0.75, 0.125) End Point: (0.0, 0.125) - Line 4: Start Point: (0.0, 0.125) End Point: (0.0, 0.0) Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Use the euler angles and translation vector defined for the coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to create a 3D solid model. Extrude the sketch by a distance of 0.5 towards the normal and do not extrude in the opposite direction. The sketch scale should be 0.75. Join this part to the previous parts.</description>
